Steven Hanser, USGS-FRESC, Snake River Field Station 2004 All Secondary Roads in the Western United States vector digital data http://srfs.wr.usgs.gov/Fresc_ScienceData/secondaryroads_hf.zip https://www.sciencebase.gov/catalog/item/5421ec74e4b06fb4967b9b48 all_secondary_roads_hf http://sagemap.wr.usgs.gov/ftp/regional/usgs/secondary_roads_hf.zip
All secondary roads in the western United States from the 2000 US Census TIGER/line files. Secondary roads are defined as all roadways not classified as an interstate, state highway, or federal highway. Base data en
2000 unknown
ground condition
Complete None planned

all_secondary_roads_hf Feature Class 6872788 Attribute table ESRI
FID Internal feature number. ESRI
Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
FID OID 4 0 0
Shape Feature geometry. ESRI
Coordinates defining the features.
Shape Geometry 0 0 0
TLID TLID Number 10 TIGER/Line® ID, Permanent Record Number U.S. Census Bureau
TLID See TIGER/Line® Files Technical Documentation: http://www.census.gov/geo/www/tiger/rd_2ktiger/tgrrd2k.pdf, page 53 for TLID description. The TIGER/Line® files use a permanent 10-digit TIGER/Line® record.
FNODE FNODE Number 8 ESRI From Node
Coordinates defining the features.
TNODE TNODE Number 8 To Node ESRI
Coordinates defining the features.
LENGTH LENGTH Number 19 5 Length of feature ESRI
Automatically Calculated.
FEDIRP FEDIRP String 2 Feature Direction, Prefix U.S. Census Bureau
Feature Direction Prefix (e.g., (N) Adams Ave) Words in parantheses indicate highlight. Character Field.
FENAME FENAME String 30 Feature Name U.S. Census Bureau
Feature Name (e.g., (US Highway 1), (Jefferson) St). Words in parantheses indicate highlight. Character Field.
FETYPE FETYPE String 4 Feature Type U.S. Census Bureau
Feature Type (Roosevelt (Blvd), Mangosteen (River)). Words in parantheses indicate highlight. Character Field.
FEDIRS FEDIRS String 2 Feature Direction, Suffix U.S. Census Bureau
Feature Direction Suffix (e.g., Providence St (NE)) Words in parantheses indicate highlight. Character Field.
CFCC CFCC String 3 Census Feature Class Code U.S. Census Bureau
CFCC See TIGER/Line® Files Technical Documentation: http://www.census.gov/geo/www/tiger/rd_2ktiger/tgrrd2k.pdf, page 84 for CFCC identification. The CFCC, as used in the TIGER/Line® files, is a three-character code. The first character is a letter describing the feature class; the second character is a number describing the major category; and the third character is a number describing the minor category.
FRADDL FRADDL Number 11 Start Address, Left U.S. Census Bureau
FRADDL See TIGER/Line® Files Technical Documentation: http://www.census.gov/geo/www/tiger/rd_2ktiger/tgrrd2k.pdf, page 80 for FRADDL identification. Numeric characters or a mixture of numeric and alphabetic characters (maximum of 11 characters). Address range fields are blank when no address range is available.
TOADDL TOADDL Number 11 End Address, Left U.S. Census Bureau
TOADDL See TIGER/Line® Files Technical Documentation: http://www.census.gov/geo/www/tiger/rd_2ktiger/tgrrd2k.pdf, page 80 for TOADDL identification. Numeric characters or a mixture of numeric and alphabetic characters (maximum of 11 characters). Address range fields are blank when no address range is available.
FRADDR FRADDR Number 11 Start Address, Right U.S. Census Bureau
FRADDR See TIGER/Line® Files Technical Documentation: http://www.census.gov/geo/www/tiger/rd_2ktiger/tgrrd2k.pdf, page 80 for FRADDR identification. Numeric characters or a mixture of numeric and alphabetic characters (maximum of 11 characters). Address range fields are blank when no address range is available.
TOADDR TOADDR Number 11 End Address, Right U.S. Census Bureau
TOADDR See TIGER/Line® Files Technical Documentation: http://www.census.gov/geo/www/tiger/rd_2ktiger/tgrrd2k.pdf, page 80 for TOADDR identification. Numeric characters or a mixture of numeric and alphabetic characters (maximum of 11 characters). Address range fields are blank when no address range is available.
ZIPL ZIPL String 5 ZIP Code®, Left U.S. Census Bureau
ZIPL See the U.S. Postal Service (USPS) Publication 65, National Five-Digit ZIP
ZIPR ZIPR String 5 ZIP Code®, Right U.S. Census Bureau
ZIPR See the U.S. Postal Service (USPS) Publication 65, National Five-Digit ZIP
CENSUS1 CENSUS1 String 1 U.S. Census Bureau Census Use 1
Assigned by US Census Bureau.
CENSUS2 CENSUS2 String 1 U.S. Census Bureau Census Use 2
Assigned by US Census Bureau.
CFCC1 CFCC1 String 1 The feature class U.S. Census Bureau
CFCC1 See TIGER/Line® Files Technical Documentation: http://www.census.gov/geo/www/tiger/rd_2ktiger/tgrrd2k.pdf, page 84 for CFCC identification. CFCC2 codes consist of the first character in the CFCC code which indicates the feature class.
CFCC2 CFCC2 String 2 The feature class with main category U.S. Census Bureau
CFCC2 See TIGER/Line® Files Technical Documentation: http://www.census.gov/geo/www/tiger/rd_2ktiger/tgrrd2k.pdf, page 84 for CFCC identification. CFCC2 codes consist of the first character in the CFCC code which indicating the feature class and the second character indicating the major category.
SOURCE SOURCE String 1 Source or First Source Code to Update U.S. Census Bureau
Source See TIGER/Line® Files Technical Documentation: http://www.census.gov/geo/www/tiger/rd_2ktiger/tgrrd2k.pdf, page 163 for source code documentation.
SOURCETHM SOURCETHM String 16 Name of file used in merge of roads. User difined
Name of data file.
All Secondary Roads in the Western United States

We make every effort to provide and maintain accurate, complete, usable, and timely information on our web sites. However, some USGS data and information accessed through these pages may, of necessity, be preliminary in nature and presented prior to final review and approval by the Director of the USGS. These data and information are provided with the understanding that they are not guaranteed to be correct or complete. Users are cautioned to consider carefully the provisional nature of these data and information before using them for decisions that concern personal or public safety or the conduct of business that involves substantial monetary or operational consequences. Conclusions drawn from, or actions undertaken on the basis of, such data and information are the sole responsibility of the user.

541-750-1030 fresc_outreach@usgs.gov
Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from a U.S. Geological Survey server, and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. The U.S. Geological Survey shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein.
